me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry

Class PointXY

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry.PointXY
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PointXY>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PointXYZ

    public class PointXY
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<PointXY>, java.io.Serializable
    A 2d coordinate with X and Y values. The foundation Pathfinder's geometry is based upon.

    A point is defined as a pair of X and Y values. These values are stored as doubles. Points are immutable objects, meaning they can not be modified once created. Many methods in the PointXY class will return a new PointXY based on whatever modifications you will have made.

    Points will be one of the most important concepts in using Pathfinder - all of the advanced geometry (rectangles, circles, shapes, etc) is based on lines and points. And you know what lines are based on? Points.

    The concept of a point is relatively straightforwards - it's literally just a pair of X and Y values. There's a ton of methods available for use, even for very niche situations. Some of the most important methods (at least the ones that I've used the most) are as follows...

    • distance(PointXY)
    • inDirection(double, Angle)
    • angleTo(PointXY)
    Additionally, it's worth noting that most (possibly all) of the methods in this class have a corresponding static method.

    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    PointXYZ, Serialized Form

      • add

        public static PointXY add(PointXY a,
                          PointXY b)
        Add two points together by creating another point with an X value of the sum of A and B's X values and a Y value of the sum of A and B's Y values.
        Parameters:
        a - one of the two points to add.
        b - one of the two points to add.
        Returns:
        a new point, created by adding the component X and Y values of each of the points together.

      • multiply

        public static PointXY multiply(PointXY a,
                               PointXY b)
        Multiply two points together.

        The new point's X value is equal to a.x() * b.x(). Likewise, the new point's Y value is equal to a.y() * b.y().

        Parameters:
        a - one of the two points to multiply.
        b - one of the two points to multiply.
        Returns:
        the product of the two point's component X and Y values.

      • multiply

        public static PointXY multiply(PointXY a,
                               double b)
        Multiply a point's X and Y values by a single multiplier.
        Parameters:
        a - the point that will be multiplied by b.
        b - the multiplier to multiply a's X and Y values.
        Returns:
        a new point, the result of multiplying a's component X and Y values by b.

        Parameters:

        b - one of the two points to average.
        Returns:

      • slope

        public static double slope(PointXY a,
                           PointXY b)
        Get the slope between two points.
        Parameters:
        a - the first of the two points.
        b - the second of the two points.
        Returns:
        the slope between the two points. This value is calculated by taking the change in Y over the change in X - in other words, (y2 minus y1) divided by (x2 minus x1).

      • areDuplicatesPresent

        public static boolean areDuplicatesPresent(PointXY... points)
        Check a set of points for any duplicates. If there are any duplicate points (points that have the same X and Y values), return true. If duplicates are not present, return false.
        Parameters:
        points - the set of points to check for duplicates.
        Returns:
        if there are no duplicates, return false. If there are duplicates, return true.

      • inDirection

        public static PointXY inDirection(PointXY base,
                                  double distance,
                                  Angle angle)
        Create a new point a given distance and angle away from a base point.
        Parameters:
        base - the base point. This serves as the center of whatever transformation the distance and angle values will cause.
        distance - the distance the new point should be away from the center point.
        angle - the angle at which the new point should be created, at a given distance away from the base.
        Returns:
        a new point, a given distance away from base, drawn at angle.

      • isNear

        public static boolean isNear(PointXY a,
                             PointXY b,
                             double tolerance)
        Are two points close to each other?
        Parameters:
        a - one of the two points.
        b - one of the two points.
        tolerance - the maximum distance value.
        Returns:
        if the `distance(a, b)` method call returns a value less than or equal to the tolerance, this method will return true. Else, this method will return false.

      • isPointNearPoints

        public static boolean isPointNearPoints(PointXY reference,
                                        double tolerance,
                                        PointXY... points)
        Is this point close to any point in a set of points?
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference point.
        tolerance - the maximum distance value that is considered "near." If the distance between this point and the shape is greater than this value, it's not considered to be "near" to the point.
        points - the set of points to test.
        Returns:
        if the reference point is near any of the points in the provided set of points, return true. Otherwise, return false.

      • isPointNearShape

        public static boolean isPointNearShape(PointXY reference,
                                       Shape<?> shape,
                                       double tolerance)
        Is a point close to a given shape?
        Parameters:
        reference - the reference point.
        shape - the shape to test.
        tolerance - the maximum distance value that is considered "near." If the distance between this point and the shape is greater than this value, it's not considered to be "near" to the point.
        Returns:
        if the reference point is "near" the shape, return true. Otherwise, return false.

      • isPointNearPoints

        public boolean isPointNearPoints(double tolerance,
                                 PointXY... points)
        Is this point close to any point in a set of points?
        Parameters:
        tolerance - the maximum distance value that is considered "near." If the distance between this point and the shape is greater than this value, it's not considered to be "near" to the point.
        points - the set of points to test.
        Returns:
        if the reference point is near any of the points in the provided set of points, return true. Otherwise, return false.

      • isPointNearShape

        public boolean isPointNearShape(Shape<?> shape,
                                double tolerance)
        Is this point close to a given shape?
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape to test.
        tolerance - the maximum distance value that is considered "near." If the distance between this point and the shape is greater than this value, it's not considered to be "near" to the point.
        Returns:
        if this point is "near" the shape, return true. Otherwise, return false.
